Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the problem with AI trading is that you are competing with the market and this means all the wall street firms using their forex algo on crypto

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the mechanics of using an AI to do trading, it is not that hard, i just havent implemented it as if it cant be making money for sure, what is the point

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @Privatoshi yes, pretty close to all the tech that is needed, we have either already done it, or it is in testing phase. we just lack the resources to pursue everything in parallel

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we have done a good job with getting all these new core capabilities, but without an end user solution, it seems nobody gives us any credit for it. and making such end user solutions simply takes a lot of effort and that is where things become serialized

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: still, crypto is still in infancy, and even with serial development of end user solutions, in a couple years we will have quite the amazing solution in place

Author: Flint#6435
Content: @jl777c  or maybe AI is being developed in its own infrastructure for a wide range of tasks? Indeed, in the coming years it will become a very relevant area without which it will be impossible to be competitive!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, a general purpose AI framework could be a useful thing, i was toying around with a modified mining approach where new coins are mined only when a better model is created. but that all comes down to the dataset that the AI is needing to work in and really a blockchain is not the best place for AI

Content: @Flint   This is something I‚Äôve been digging into.  ( distributed computing ) , specifically for one kind of task,  ( password cracking ) but the model for the coin behind it is the same . Basically donate computing power , get a coin, coin is used to vote on priority of job orders .  Value of coin is based  on customers marginal utility of the computation service .
